## Missing Data

# Model

## Naive Approach
```{r Logistic Model}
# Fit a logistic model
mod0 <- glm(TenYearCHD ~ ., data = df_complete, family = binomial())

summary(mod0)
```

## Ridge 
```{r Ridge Model}
col_names <- colnames(df_complete)
predictors <- col_names[!col_names == "education"]

df_sub <- df_complete[, predictors]

sapply(df_sub, class)

X <- df_complete[, !names(df_complete) %in% c("TenYearCHD")]
y <- df_complete["TenYearCHD"]

X["education"] <- factor(X$education, labels = c("None","Highschool", "Collage", "Grad"))

mod_ridge <- glmnet(X, y, family = "binomial")

summary(mod_ridge)
glmnet
```
